verses.verse: Therefore leaving <S%G863><s%> the principles <S%G746><s%> of the doctrine <S%G3056><s%> of Christ, <S%G5547><s%> let us go <S%G5342><s%> on to perfection; <S%G5051><s%> not laying <S%G2598><s%> again <S%G3825><s%> the foundation <S%G2310><s%> of repentance <S%G3341><s%> from dead <S%G3498><s%> works, <S%G2041><s%> and of faith <S%G4102><s%> toward <S%G1909><s%> God, <S%G2316><s%>

Of the doctrine <S%G1322><s%> of baptisms, <S%G909><s%> and of laying <S%G1936><s%> on <S%G1936><s%> of hands, <S%G5495><s%> and of resurrection <S%G386><s%> of the dead, <S%G3498><s%> and of eternal <S%G166><s%> judgment. <S%G2917><s%>
And this <S%G5124><s%> will we do, <S%G4160><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> permit. <S%G2010><s%>

For it is impossible <S%G102><s%> for those <S%G3588><s%> who were once <S%G530><s%> enlightened, <S%G5461><s%> and have <S%G2192><s%> tasted <S%G1089><s%> of the heavenly <S%G2032><s%> gift, <S%G1431><s%> and were made <S%G1096><s%> partakers <S%G3353><s%> of the Holy <S%G40><s%> Ghost, <S%G4151><s%>
And have <S%G2192><s%> tasted <S%G1089><s%> the good <S%G2570><s%> word <S%G4487><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> and the powers <S%G1411><s%> of the world <S%G165><s%> to come, <S%G3195><s%>

If they shall fall <S%G3895><s%> away, <S%G3895><s%> to renew <S%G340><s%> them again <S%G3825><s%> to repentance; <S%G3341><s%> seeing they crucify <S%G388><s%> to themselves <S%G1438><s%> the Son <S%G5207><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> afresh, <S%G388><s%> and put <S%G3856><s%> him to an open <S%G3856><s%> shame. <S%G3856><s%>

For the earth <S%G1093><s%> which <S%G3588><s%> drinks <S%G4095><s%> in the rain <S%G5205><s%> that comes <S%G2064><s%> oft <S%G4178><s%> on it, and brings <S%G5088><s%> forth <S%G5088><s%> herbs <S%G1008><s%> meet <S%G2111><s%> for them by whom <S%G3739><s%> it is dressed, <S%G1090><s%> receives <S%G3335><s%> blessing <S%G2129><s%> from God: <S%G2316><s%>

But that which bears <S%G1627><s%> thorns <S%G173><s%> and briers <S%G5146><s%> is rejected, <S%G96><s%> and is near <S%G1451><s%> to cursing; <S%G2671><s%> whose <S%G3739><s%> end <S%G5056><s%> is to be burned. <S%G2740><s%>

But, beloved, <S%G27><s%> we are persuaded <S%G3982><s%> better <S%G2909><s%> things of you, and things that accompany <S%G2192><s%> salvation, <S%G4991><s%> though <S%G1499><s%> we thus <S%G3779><s%> speak. <S%G2980><s%>

For God <S%G2316><s%> is not unrighteous <S%G94><s%> to forget <S%G1950><s%> your <S%G5216><s%> work <S%G2041><s%> and labor <S%G2873><s%> of love, <S%G26><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> you have <S%G2192><s%> showed <S%G1731><s%> toward <S%G1519><s%> his name, <S%G3686><s%> in that you have <S%G2192><s%> ministered <S%G1247><s%> to the saints, <S%G40><s%> and do minister. <S%G1247><s%>

And we desire <S%G1937><s%> that every <S%G1538><s%> one of you do show <S%G1731><s%> the same <S%G846><s%> diligence <S%G4710><s%> to the full <S%G4136><s%> assurance <S%G4136><s%> of hope <S%G1680><s%> to the end: <S%G5056><s%>
That you be not slothful, <S%G3576><s%> but followers <S%G3402><s%> of them who through <S%G1223><s%> faith <S%G4102><s%> and patience <S%G3115><s%> inherit <S%G2816><s%> the promises. <S%G1860><s%>

For when God <S%G2316><s%> made <S%G1861><s%> promise <S%G1861><s%> to Abraham, <S%G11><s%> because <S%G1893><s%> he could <S%G2192><s%> swear <S%G3660><s%> by no <S%G3762><s%> greater, <S%G3187><s%> he swore <S%G3660><s%> by himself, <S%G1438><s%>
Saying, <S%G3004><s%> Surely <S%G2229><s%> blessing <S%G2129><s%> I will bless <S%G2127><s%> you, and multiplying <S%G4129><s%> I will multiply <S%G4129><s%> you.
And so, <S%G3779><s%> after he had patiently <S%G3114><s%> endured, <S%G3114><s%> he obtained <S%G2013><s%> the promise. <S%G1860><s%>

For men <S%G444><s%> truly <S%G3303><s%> swear <S%G3660><s%> by the greater: <S%G3187><s%> and an oath <S%G3727><s%> for confirmation <S%G951><s%> is to them an end <S%G4009><s%> of all <S%G3956><s%> strife. <S%G485><s%>

Wherein <S%G1722><s%> <S%G3757><s%> God, <S%G2316><s%> willing <S%G1014><s%> more <S%G4054><s%> abundantly <S%G4054><s%> to show <S%G1925><s%> to the heirs <S%G2818><s%> of promise <S%G1860><s%> the immutability <S%G276><s%> of his counsel, <S%G1012><s%> confirmed <S%G3315><s%> it by an oath: <S%G3727><s%>

That by two <S%G1417><s%> immutable <S%G276><s%> things, in which <S%G3739><s%> it was impossible <S%G102><s%> for God <S%G2316><s%> to lie, <S%G5574><s%> we might have <S%G2192><s%> a strong <S%G2478><s%> consolation, <S%G3874><s%> who <S%G3588><s%> have fled <S%G2703><s%> for refuge <S%G2703><s%> to lay hold <S%G2902><s%> on the hope <S%G1680><s%> set <S%G4295><s%> before <S%G4295><s%> us:

Which <S%G3739><s%> hope we have <S%G2192><s%> as an anchor <S%G45><s%> of the soul, <S%G5590><s%> both <S%G5037><s%> sure <S%G804><s%> and steadfast, <S%G949><s%> and which enters <S%G1535><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> that within <S%G2082><s%> the veil; <S%G2665><s%>

Where <S%G3699><s%> the forerunner <S%G4274><s%> is for us entered, <S%G1525><s%> even Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> made <S%G1096><s%> an high <S%G749><s%> priest <S%G749><s%> for ever <S%G165><s%> after <S%G2596><s%> the order <S%G5010><s%> of Melchisedec. <S%G3198><s%>
